moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 f5 3. Nf3 e6 4. Nbd2: This is a hard set for me to break.
moves.4... Be7 5. g3: This must be a mistake. I try to control the black B and open a possible nice square for my lsb.
moves.5... g5: I can play Be5, etc, but I tried
moves.6. Be3: "Tempting" black into f4, in order to make me open the g file. I hoped I could make it good for me.
moves.6... c6: Weak, weak move. Black has to press on my kingside.
moves.7. h4: Crazy strike: I don't want to passively wait, and if he is passive, let's "wake up" him.
moves.7... g4 8. Ng5: ?? Blunder. I lose the N after h6. I realized it just a second too late.
moves.8... Nf6: ?? He didn't! Still I can't save the N in one move...
moves.9. Bf4: If h6, Be5, pinning the N to the R.
moves.9... Bd7 10. Be5 O-O: Preventing it. It's getting very dark...
moves.11... h6: He did see it, finally. I couldn't figure out a better compensation, so I took the pawn. I think now it was a bad idea.
moves.12. Nxe6 Bxe6 13. e3 Nbd7 14. Be2 gxf3 1: Reorganizing. He didn't want to take my B, and I like it.
moves.16... Ng4 17. Qd3: I know e6 will be my headache.
moves.17... Bh5 18. O-O-O: ?? Desperate, I overlooked the typical fork!
